Job Description:
About Us:
White Water Marine Hardware is a wholesale distributor of stainless steel marine hardware for boating. We import marine hardware from our factories, stock in our two locations (California and Florida) and we sell to some of the best boat builders in the country! This role is for our in-person Chino, California location.
Aside from our B2B operation, we also sell through various aftermarket platforms such as Amazon, Ebay, Walmart, and our own sister company website marinedepotdirect.com There will be plenty of on-the-job training, so you don’t have to worry about being familiar with boats, boating, or the hardware to start!
Company Culture:
We’re a team full of passionate and engaged people focused on making a difference. A successful candidate works well in a dynamic environment with minimal supervision. We pitch in and help each other to get the job done, but we also mix in some company fun! We try for monthly company lunches, a relaxed and friendly atmosphere, and a good mix of conversation and fun! We also take everybody’s ideas seriously. So, if you have an idea for improvement, you can expect to be heard and respected.

OVERVIEW – JOB DESCRIPTION:
Communica is an integrated advertising, marketing and public relations firm headquartered in Toledo’s Warehouse District with regional offices in Charlotte, Columbus and Detroit. We partnered with our first client in 1988 and they are still our client today, growing as we grow.
For more than 30 years, Communica has developed award-winning, high-impact campaigns for regional, national and international organizations by engaging with their core audiences and growing awareness, building preference and increasing revenue for their brands.
We are currently seeking a self-motivated, results oriented MARKETING INSIGHTS ANALYST.
We’re looking for a dynamic data storyteller with digital advertising experience to bolster the core reporting and analytics services we provide to our clients. If you’re part data gatherer, part business analyst and you enjoy using data to drive effective marketing and communication strategies, you have an exciting opportunity to grow with Communica. We believe you will love working with us as we have a great culture and team! We offer in-office, hybrid and remote opportunities as work options.

Colorado Public Radio (CPR) is seeking a Pardot Marketing Analyst.
About the Position:
The Pardot Marketing Analyst is a new position at CPR that will be the subject matter expert for our Pardot and Salesforce Marketing Cloud Engagement platform. You will maximize Pardot’s usage for the entire organization by determining how it can be optimized to help meet revenue and marketing goals. You will develop email marketing automation strategies, plan for system updates and releases, identify inefficiencies in the system and determine best practices on how Pardot is implemented and administered. You will create rules for others to follow in Pardot, provide guidance, maintain the platform on a day-to-day basis and develop a roadmap for growth.
This is not a remote position. The Pardot Analyst is expected to reside in the Denver Metro area upon starting.

Marketing Analyst
If your passion and superpower are digging into data to uncover gaps, trends and a-ha’s and turning those insights into actions that you’ll use to drive new customer acquisition and repeat sales growth, this might be the perfect role for you.
As our Marketing Analyst, you’ll love all things associated with customer behavior and apply your unique mix of marketing knowledge, technical acumen, and killer analytical skills to continually optimize inquiry and conversion performance while keeping marketing costs at or below thresholds.
Daily, you’ll be “elbow-deep” in evaluating omni-channel marketing data from multiple channels such as company website, social media, search engine optimization, email, print and more. You’ll be one of our resident experts on our core target customers and their key psychographic, demographic and socio-graphic makeup. You’ll have a strong testing strategy to validate your hypothesis and create more rocket fuel for our aggressive growth strategy and plans.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
-Conduct weekly, and monthly sales data reports and monitor sales performance -Provide data-driven insights to improve ranking, traffic, and revenue KPIs
-Create multivariate data forecast models to help predict potential business scenarios -Manage, maintain, and using internal database system to organize and store data
-Conduct market research and industry data reports -Working with Managers on SOP optimizations -Working with Managers on Supply Chain and Logistics Management Position Requirements:
-Bachelor's degree in Applied Statistics, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Marketing or related fields; or relevant experience.
-Proficient in advanced Microsoft Excel (VLOOKUP's, pivot tables), R/Python, SQL

JOB DESCRIPTION
The Insights Analyst provides support to the GAF Insights in the execution of Voice of the Customer and Market Research initiatives, the results of which will drive GAF’s overall Brand, Product, Advertising, Marketing and Customer Program strategy.
The Insights Analyst is responsible for assisting the various functions across GAF with marketing research, consumer and customer insights projects to drive the strategy for new product development, branding efforts, contractor programs and other key aspects of marketing. This role is focused on Research Operations, Project Management and Conducting marketing research and analysis by leveraging company tools or through managing vendor relationships.
The ideal candidate will have an analytical mindset while being intellectually curious as they help develop and deliver the information that will drive and support Marketing Strategy. This person is Customer Obsessed - a listener and asks questions while working with their customers to clearly identify needs upon which to base and develop insights requests and market research plans. Marketing research experience is preferred, but willing to train the right candidate with prior project management and analysis experience.

Description:
The IRONMAN Group operates a global portfolio of events that includes the IRONMAN® Triathlon Series, the IRONMAN® 70.3® Triathlon Series, 5150™ Triathlon Series, the Rock ‘n’ Roll® Running Series, IRONKIDS®, World Triathlon Championship Series, Epic Series™ mountain bike races including the Absa Cape Epic®, road cycling events including Haute Route®, and other multisport races.
The IRONMAN Group is the largest operator of mass participation sports in the world and provides more than a million participants annually with the benefits of endurance sports through the company’s vast offerings. Since the inception of the iconic IRONMAN® brand and its first event in 1978, athletes have proven that ANYTHING IS POSSIBLE® by crossing finish lines around the world. Beginning as a single race, The IRONMAN Group has grown to become a global sensation with hundreds of events across 55+ countries. For more information about The IRONMAN Group visit: www.ironman.com.

Excellent organizational skills

Detail-oriented, works efficiently, and consistently meets deadlines

Additional coverage is available for dependents. We cover 40% of the cost and the employee is responsible for 60% of the cost.
We cover long-term disability costs.
Voluntary benefits include short-term disability and employee and dependent life insurance.
Generous PTO plan that increases over time.
7 paid holidays per year and one floating holiday (employee’s choice).
401k enrollment eligibility is on the 1st of the month following the first 30 days of employment. We contribute to the plan after only 6 months of service and match your 401k contribution as follows: 25% match on deferrals up to 8% of pay.

Who We Are:

Thrive Causemetics is Bigger Than Beauty™: We are an independent, female-owned beauty brand that creates high-performance vegan cosmetics and supports a community of giving. All of Thrive Causemetics' products are free of parabens and sulfates, in addition to being 100 percent cruelty-free. Through its Bigger Than Beauty™ program, every product you purchase results in a donation to help a woman thrive. Thrive Causemetics is dedicated to fostering a collaborative and cross-functional workplace where everyone’s voice matters. We are committed to being pioneers in creating a culture of wellness. Together, we prioritize a strong work ethic while maintaining a positive, exciting environment where people are passionate about what they do.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:
Wondr Health is the proven leader in digital behavior transformation. Leveraging over 15 years of behavior change experience and partnership with health plans and employers, Wondr Health delivers interrelated, personalized, skill-building programs for full-spectrum weight management, mindfulness and movement that improve the physical and emotional health of participants. Powered by data-driven engagement expertise and personalized programming, and supported by expert content and coaching, the company’s flexible and scalable solutions engage populations, improve quality of life and health outcomes, and prevent and reduce the cost of chronic health conditions.
